featured.text: It is estimated that there are currently over 500,000 pieces of man-made trash orbiting the Earth at speeds of up to 17,500 miles per hour.
Residents are told not to dump all household waste _____ into the trash can; reusable materials should first be sorted out and recycled.
Studies show that asking children to do house _____, such as taking out the trash or doing the dishes, helps them grow into responsible adults.

other.text: Future plans include a cooperative effort among many nations to stop littering in space and to clean up the trash already there.
The generator is now in place at the cactus market, where the vendors are enthusiastic about this new way to utilize the tons of cactus husks that once went directly into the trash.
Scientists have cleaned up most of the trash.
What was the first piece of man-made space trash? (A) A camera.
Why were scientists NOT concerned about space trash in the beginning? (A) It no longer served any useful purpose.
Here is a sentence: “Almost nothing of a fish is left for the trash bin.” Which paragraph is most suitable to have it as the final sentence?
What has been done about the space trash problem? (A)
Ground stations have been built to monitor larger pieces of space trash to prevent them from crashing into working satellites or space shuttles.
But, since our space journey started we have left so much trash there that scientists are now concerned that if we don’t clean it up, we may all be in mortal danger.
The major problem with the space trash is that it may hit working satellites and damage traveling spacecraft.

definition.example: Please take out the trash before the garbage truck arrives.
